str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A Philippian, an inhabitant of Philippi. From Philippoi; a Philippesian, i.e. Native of Philippi.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From archomai; a commencement, or chief.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
(Hebrew), Macedonia, a Roman province north of Achaia (Greece). From Makedon; Macedonia, a region of Greece.
No one, none, nothing.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From koinonos; to share with others.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A giving, gift, donation. From the base of didomi; a giving; by implication, a gift.
And, even, also, namely.
A receiving. From lambano; receipt.
